;;西班牙国王费利佩六世、王后莱蒂齐亚和欧洲国家领导人在参观阿罕布拉宫狮子庭院时合影留念，2023 年 10 月 5 日在西班牙格拉纳达举行的欧洲政治共同体峰会当天。REUTERS/Jon Nazca/档案照片;
;

;波兰指责柏林和布鲁塞尔对波兰实施移民“指令”欧盟和匈牙利表示，随着欧盟领导人齐聚一堂，解决来自中东和非洲的移民数量不断增加的问题，欧盟正在强行通过一项协议。

;

;在西班牙格拉纳达市举行的欧盟峰会正在寻求解决办法减少通过常规边境口岸抵达欧洲的难民和移民数量，这是意大利、西班牙和德国特别关心的问题。

;

;但欧盟在如何分担难民和移民的任务方面仍存在分歧。为那些踏上旅程的人提供帮助。尽管遭到波兰和匈牙利民粹主义政府的反对，成员国之间上周还是达成了一项长期停滞的协议。

;

;匈牙利反移民领导人维克多·欧尔班 (Victor Orban) 抵达会谈时表示，在移民问题上达成一致是不可能的，因为欧盟已将匈牙利和波兰排除在协议之外。

;

;“如果你……被迫接受你不喜欢的东西，你希望如何达成妥协和协议？这是不可能的， ” 欧尔班告诉记者。

;

;波兰总理马特乌什·莫拉维茨基 (Mateusz Morawiecki) 抱怨欧盟强迫他的国家接受非法移民，否则将面临罚款。

;

;“我将在今天的会议上表示，波兰坚决反对拒绝这一点，首先是因为我们国家的安全。”他说。

;

;周三，22 个欧盟国家;就如何在入境人数异常高的情况下处理非正常移民达成协议;，朝着彻底改革欧盟的庇护和移民规则迈出了一步。

;

;该协议现在必须与欧洲议会进一步谈判。虽然波兰和匈牙利无法正式阻止该协议，但它们的坚决反对引发了人们对最终协议如何有效实施的质疑。

;

;拥有 4.5 亿人口的欧盟最高移民官员上周表示今年到目前为止，已有 25 万名非正常入境者，远低于 2015 年，当时有超过 100 万人跨海入境，压倒了整个欧盟。

;

;但此事具有政治敏感性，且存在反移民言论，在明年六月欧洲大陆范围内的欧洲议会选举之前，一些欧盟国家的政策正在上升。

;

;;意大利;和;西班牙;对今年海上入境人数增加表示担忧，而六月份的希腊水域则是;欧洲多年来最严重的海难;，造成数百名移民死亡。

;

;自周末以来，已有 1,000 多名移民抵达这座小岛。西班牙加那利群岛的埃尔耶罗 (El Hierro) 人口为 11,000。

;

;德国是许多到达欧洲的移民的首选目的地国家，;引入了边境检查;，称需要它们来打击人口走私者。

;

;这一决定已做出德国报告称今年庇护申请增加了近 80%，这引发了中左翼执政联盟在 10 月 8 日巴伐利亚州和黑森州地区选举之前的担忧。

;

;邻国波兰将举行选举一周后，即 10 月 15 日举行全国大选。

;

;尽管波兰为逃离俄罗斯 2022 年 2 月入侵的数百万乌克兰人提供了庇护，但华沙和布达佩斯拒绝接待来自地中海的难民。

;< p>;其他;欧盟中部和东部国家;还在通常开放的旅行区内设立了边境管制，理由是需要打击逃避正常过境和抵达程序的人口走私者和移民。

; Fri, 06 Oct 2023 17:55:04 +0800 Bomb threat to Philippine airports “likely a hoax“ - policehttps://reuters.com/article/phlippines-security/bomb-threat-to-philippine-airports-likely-a-hoax-police-idUSKBN3160CV

;;2023 年 1 月 2 日，菲律宾马尼拉大都会帕赛市，乘客在尼诺·阿基诺国际机场的航空公司柜台前排队。REUTERS/埃洛伊萨·洛佩兹/档案照片;
;

;航空警察局长周五表示，促使菲律宾将其所有商业机场置于高度安全戒备状态的匿名炸弹威胁“很可能是一场骗局”。

;

;当局在收到一封匿名电子邮件威胁后，下令全国 42 个机场加强安全，威胁称从马尼拉飞往多个旅游目的地的飞机可能会爆炸。

;

;尽管发出了警报，但该国的马尼拉主要国际机场及其两家最大的航空公司均正常运营，交通部长 Jaime Bautista 表示预计不会出现航班延误。

;

;作为“当局表示，机场“立即加强安全措施”，并补充说威胁正在得到核实。

;

;民航局（CAAP）表示，周三已下令机场“在收到炸弹威胁后”加强安全措施。< /p>;

;它补充说，空中交通服务收到一封匿名电子邮件，内容涉及从马尼拉飞往达沃、比科尔以及巴拉望岛和宿务旅游区的航班受到威胁。

;

;在一份日期为 10 月 4 日的备忘录中，但周五向媒体发布的 CAAP 提到了电子邮件威胁的屏幕截图，其中不包含“炸弹”一词，但表示“一架飞机将在马尼拉国际机场爆炸”，“请小心”。

;

;匿名电子邮件称，“宿务、巴拉望、比科尔和达沃也将受到影响”。

;

;作为该地区最受欢迎的海滩目的地之一，宿务去年接待了超过 100 万国内外游客，而据旅游部门称，菲律宾中部比科尔的游客数量接近 500 万。

;

;航空警察局长 Jack Wanky 证实，威胁是在周三上午 8 点（格林威治标准时间 0000）左右发出的，但他表示对此表示怀疑关于它。

;

;“这很可能是一个骗局。没有发生任何事情，”他说。

;

;“机场运营持续进行，很正常。”

;

;比科尔的一个地区机场首先收到了这封电子邮件。国家首都地区的警方也收到了类似的邮件信息并通知了航空警察。

;

;周五从马尼拉起飞的澳大利亚商务旅客凯文·比奇利 (Kevin Beachley) 表示，他并不担心。

;

;“这只是造成很多后果的简单方法。他说：“除了打电话之外，实际上不需要做任何事情就可以解决麻烦。”

;

;菲律宾公民乔伊·内昆托 (Joy Nequinto) 则更加谨慎。

;

;“我们的安全并不那么安全，尤其是在马尼拉。我确实喜欢菲律宾，但有时我在机场感到害怕。”

;

;菲律宾航空公司的一位消息人士表示，该航空公司正在运营。由于无权接受媒体采访，该消息人士拒绝透露姓名。 “一切如常”。

;

;宿务太平洋航空​​的一位发言人表示，该航空公司正在“遵循通常的协议”。

;

;“预计不会对任何定期航班造成影响，我们希望确保交通部长在一份声明中表示，“我们已制定相关协议来确保每个人的安全”。

;;7 月 16 日，美国财政部长珍妮特·耶伦在印度甘地讷格尔举行的 G20 财长和央行行长会议期间在新闻发布会上发表讲话，2023。路透社/Amit Dave/档案照片;
;

;美国财政部长珍妮特·耶伦下周将出席在摩洛哥举行的国际货币基金组织和世界银行年会，以推动美国的优先事项，包括增加这些机构的资金在美国国会政治混乱的背景下。

;

;财政部周五表示，耶伦将在马拉喀什市的会议上努力推动世界​​银行和她发起的其他多边开发银行的改革一年前，他们将使命扩大到减贫之外，以帮助应对气候变化和其他全球挑战。

;

;耶伦还将敦促国际货币基金组织成员国为增加基金组织的;基于配额的贷款资源;，而不对其股权结构进行任何改变，这将给予更多

;

;一位美国财政部官员还表示，耶伦将在会议上主张各国和机构提供乌克兰对抗俄罗斯入侵所需的尽可能多的资金。

;

;但耶伦此行，包括随后在卢森堡参加 10 月 16 日举行的欧元集团财长会议，紧接着美国爆发融资危机，国会以微弱优势避免了联邦政府关门。临时资助措施未能包括为乌克兰申请的资金。

;

;国会中的强硬派共和党人也领导了一场叛乱，导致众议院议长凯文·麦卡锡史无前例地被罢黜。 ;取代麦卡锡;的努力可能会推迟更多永久性支出以及其他立法。

;

;伊利诺伊州民主党众议员尼基·布津斯基 (Nikki Budzinski) 表示，由于耶伦在海外施压美国利益，她对国内“不稳定和混乱”的形象感到担忧。

;

;“我认为世界各地的每个人都在关注。美国处于领先地位，这一点不会被忽视，”布津斯基告诉路透社。

;

;当被问及国会的戏剧性事件是否破坏了耶伦的信息时，财政部官员表示，她在世界上有信誉这位官员表示，财政部提出的国际货币基金组织和世界银行的融资方案应该会在国会中引起两党的吸引力。拜登政府一直在寻求将这些机构描绘成各国向中国借款的替代方案。

;

;“更广泛地说，在一系列问题上，我们只需进去与我们的合作伙伴交谈，”官员表示。 “他们明白每个国家都有自己的政治，每个人都明白这一点，所以你只需要尽力完成你能做的事情，并在你在那里的时候与你的合作伙伴交谈。”该官员表示。在卢森堡，耶伦将与欧盟同行讨论如何更好地调整美国和欧洲对中国经济实践的态度。

;

;耶伦在;7月访问北京;拜登政府寻求与中国基于公平竞争环境的良性竞争，但不会犹豫是否要保护其国家安全利益并“降低”其供应链的风险。

;

;当被问及耶伦是否会在马拉喀什会见中国官员时，该官员拒绝就她的双边会议日程发表评论。

; Fri, 06 Oct 2023 17:25:04 +0800 Analysis: Is the US strategy of engaging China working?https://reuters.com/article/usa-china-diplomacy/analysis-is-the-us-strategy-of-engaging-china-working-idUSKBN3160M3
;;2023-10-06T09:10:13Z;
;;
;;美国国务卿安东尼·布林肯在美国华盛顿国务院举行的美墨高级别经济对话新闻发布会上发表讲话，2023年9月29日。路透社/Leah Millis/资料图;
;

;拜登执政初期，美国国务卿安东尼·布林肯誓言，只有在中国主导的情况下，美国才会与中国举行会谈以“切实成果”来解决战略竞争对手之间的争端。

;

;两年半后，这种做法似乎发生了变化。

;

;自夏季开始以来，政府已着手与北京方面进行了基本上无回应的对话，建立了工作组并向北京派遣了三名内阁级官员及其最高气候特使。

;

;该战略的部分目的是为了挽救两国关系今年早些时候，美国击落了一个中国间谍气球，局势跌至危险水平，这可能导致美国总统乔·拜登和中国国家主席习近平在 11 月举行一年来的首次会晤。

;

;拜登政府的一位高级官员表示：“我们的目标确实是建立沟通渠道并确保我们不会陷入冲突——就这么简单。” “气温比以前低了。”

;

;但批评者表示，这种做法也存在风险：谈判和工作组只会将焦点从制裁、出口管制和竞争上转移开，甚至可能会推迟。

;

;“恢复高层经济对话对中国来说是一场胜利，特别是在北京继续在减少军事风险、网络盗窃和人权问题上采取阻挠和煽风点火的情况下，”前白宫官员伊万·卡纳帕蒂 (Ivan Kanapathy) 表示众议院国家安全委员会亚洲事务副高级主任。

;

;;Smoke rises from Syria's Kurdish-controlled northeast city of Qamishli, Syria October 5, 2023. REUTERS/Orhan Qereman/File Photo;
;

;Turkey's military "neutralised" 26 Kurdish militants in northern Syria overnight in retaliation for a rocket attack on a Turkish base, the defence ministry said on Friday as conflict escalated nearly a week after a bomb attack in Ankara.

;

;Turkey typically uses the term "neutralised" to mean killed.

;

;The rocket attack on the base, by the Syrian Kurdish YPG militia, killed one Turkish police officer and wounded seven officers and soldiers in northwest Syria's Dabiq area on Thursday evening, Ankara said.

;

;The defence ministry said Turkey separately conducted air strikes and destroyed 30 militant targets elsewhere in northern Syria, including an oil well, a storage facility and shelters.

;

;The outlawed Kurdistan Workers Party (PKK) claimed responsibility for Sunday's bombing in Ankara that left the two attackers dead and wounded two police officers. Turkey said the attackers came from Syria but the Syrian SDF forces denied this.

;

;Turkey lists the YPG as a terrorist organisation and says it is indistinguishable from the PKK, which has fought an insurgency against the Turkish state since 1984 in which more than 40,000 people have been killed.

;

;The United States and European Union deem the PKK but not the YPG as terrorists.

;

;The YPG is also at the heart of the SDF forces in the US-led coalition against Islamic State militants. US support for them has long caused tension with Turkey.

;

;The SDF said Turkish attacks had killed eight people since the Ankara bombing.

;

;Underscoring the tension, the Pentagon said the United States had on Thursday ;shot down an armed Turkish drone; that was operating near its troops in Syria, the first time Washington has brought down an aircraft of NATO ally Turkey.

;

;A Pentagon spokesman said Turkish drones were seen carrying out airstrikes in Hasakah, northeast Syria, and one drone came within less than a half a kilometre (0.3 miles) of US troops, was deemed a threat and shot down by F-16 aircraft.

;

;A Turkish defence ministry official said the drone did not belong to the Turkish armed forces. However, a security source said Turkey's National Intelligence Agency (MIT) had carried out strikes in Syria against Kurdish militant targets.

;

;Ankara said on Thursday a ground operation into Syria was one option it could consider. Turkey has mounted several previous incursions into northern Syria against the YPG.

; Fri, 06 Oct 2023 16:55:05 +0800 Russian parliament to look at revoking ratification of nuclear test ban treaty - speakerhttps://reuters.com/article/ukraine-crisis-russia-nuclear-test/russian-parliament-to-look-at-revoking-ratification-of-nuclear-test-ban-treaty-speaker-idUSKBN3160AK

;;Russia's State Duma Speaker Vyacheslav Volodin attends a military parade on Victory Day, which marks the 77th anniversary of the victory over Nazi Germany in World War Two, in Red Square in central Moscow, Russia May 9, 2022. REUTERS/Maxim Shemetov;
;

;Russia on Friday indicated it was moving swiftly towards revoking its ratification of the Comprehensive Nuclear Test Ban Treaty after President Vladimir Putin held out the possibility of resuming nuclear testing.

;

;Putin on Thursday said Russia's ;nuclear doctrine; - which sets out the conditions under which he would press the nuclear button - did not need updating but that he was not yet ready to say whether or not Russia needed to resume nuclear tests.

;

;The Kremlin chief said that Russia could look at revoking ratification of the Comprehensive Nuclear Test Ban Treaty (CTBT) as the United States had signed it but not ratified.

;

;Just hours after Putin's comments, Russia's top lawmaker, Vyacheslav Volodin, said the State Duma lower house of parliament would swiftly consider if there was a need to revoke Russia's ratification of the treaty.

;

;"At the next meeting of the State Duma Council, we will definitely discuss the issue of revoking the ratification of the Comprehensive Nuclear Test Ban Treaty," Volodin said.

;

;Putin's comments, followed by Volodin's, indicate that Russia is seriously considering revoking ratification of the treaty, which bans nuclear explosions by everyone, everywhere.

;

;A resumption of nuclear tests by Russia, the United States or China could indicate the start of a new nuclear arms race between the big powers who stopped nuclear testing in the years following the 1991 collapse of the Soviet Union.

;

;For some scientists and campaigners, the splurge of nuclear bomb testing during the Cold War indicated the folly of nuclear brinkmanship which could ultimately destroy humanity and contaminate the planet for hundreds of thousands of years.

;

;But the Ukraine war has raised tensions between Moscow and Washington to the highest level since the 1962 Cuban Missile Crisis just as China seeks to bolster its nuclear arsenal to accord with its newly-found status as an emerging superpower.

;

;Putin controls around ;5,889 nuclear warheads; as of 2023, compared with 5,244 controlled by US President Joe Biden, according to the Federation of American Scientists. China has a total of 410 warheads, France 290 and Britain 225.

;

;In the five decades between 1945 and the 1996 Comprehensive Nuclear Test-Ban Treaty, more than 2,000 nuclear tests were carried out, 1,032 of them by the United States and 715 of them by the Soviet Union, according to the United Nations.

;

;The Soviet Union last tested in 1990. The United States last tested in 1992.

;

;But signs have emerged that testing could resume.

;

;In 2020, The ;Washington Post; reported that the administration of then US President Donald Trump had discussed whether or not to conduct a nuclear test.

;

;Putin said on Thursday that Russia had successfully tested a nuclear-powered and nuclear-capable cruise missile - the Burevestnik - whose capabilities he has called unmatched.

;

;China is building hundreds of intercontinental ballistic missile silos, according to the ;2023 Annual Threat Assessment; by the US intelligence community.

;

;CNN reported earlier this month that satellite images showed ;increasing activity at; nuclear test sites in Russia, China and the United States.

;

;According to the United States, China is reorienting its nuclear posture for strategic rivalry with the United States, and is not interested in any arms control agreements which lock in US or Russian nuclear dominance.

;

;"China and Russia are seeking to ensure strategic stability with the United States through the growth and development of a range of weapons capabilities, including non-traditional weapons intended to defeat or evade US missile defences," according to the US threat assessment.

;

;"Consequently, these new technologies probably will challenge the way states think about arms control, and we expect it will be difficult to achieve agreement on new weapon definitions or verification measures, particularly at the multilateral level."
